How are governments responding to the Coronavirus pandemic?
entry.summary: How are countries responding to the pandemic? When and what measures have countries put in place?

entry.title: What can data on testing tell us about the pandemic?
entry.summary: Data on the extent of testing for COVID-19 provides important information about the reliability of the data we use to understand the spread of the virus’. Here we discuss two measures of the extent testing and what they can tell us about the pandemic.

entry.title: How to embed interactive COVID-19 charts in your articles
entry.summary: Our goal is to bring together the best data and build the visualization tools that allows you to understand the spread of the pandemic. Our free, open-access charts cover all countries in the world. Here we show how to customize and embed charts in your own articles.

entry.title: To understand the global pandemic, we need global testing – the Our World in Data COVID-19 Testing dataset
entry.summary: Without testing for COVID-19 we cannot know how many people are infected with the disease. And without this data we cannot know what is happening. That is why we are bringing together the available data on testing from countries around the world.

entry.title: What do we know about the risk of dying from COVID-19?
entry.summary: If someone is infected with COVID-19, how likely is that person to die? We look closer at the metrics used to discuss mortality risk, and what we can and cannot say from the available data.

entry.title: We teamed up with Kurzgesagt to make a video about the COVID-19 pandemic
entry.summary: We worked with the Youtube channel, Kurzgesagt, to make a video on the COVID-19 pandemic and what to do about it.

entry.title: COVID-19 deaths and cases: how do sources compare?
entry.summary: There are three main data sources on the latest Coronavirus outbreak (COVID-19). How do estimates of confirmed cases and deaths compare?
